column2: Protect the environment and restore natural resources. Preserve biodiversity and reduce biodiversity loss.
column5: The protection of the environment and restoration of natural resources in TA3.11 can positively impact the development of zero-emission ocean-going vessels in TA4.45 by promoting sustainable practices and reducing pollution.

column2: By 2030, manufacturing capacity in the Union of the strategic net-zero technologies listed in the Annex approaches or reaches a benchmark of at least 40% of the Union’s annual deployment needs for the corresponding technologies necessary to achieve the Union’s 2030 climate and energy targets
column5: The manufacturing capacity target in TA3.12 may have a negative impact on the development of zero-emission ocean-going vessels in TA4.45 if it prioritizes other technologies over those needed for zero-emission vessels.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall ensure that all waste portable batteries, Light Means of Transport (LMT) batteries, and SLI batteries, regardless of their nature, chemical composition, condition, brand, or origin, are collected separately in the territory of a Member State where they make these batteries available on the market for the first time.
column5: The collection and recycling of batteries in TA3.15 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries: 45 % by 31 December 2023, 63 % by 31 December 2027, 73 % by 31 December 2030.
column5: The collection targets for waste portable batteries in TA3.16 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Producers of LMT (Light Means of Transport) batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets of waste LMT batteries: 51 % by 31 December 2028, 61 % by 31 December 2031.
column5: The collection targets for waste LMT batteries in TA3.17 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Recycled content in industrial batteries, electric vehicle batteries, LMT batteries, and SLI batteries: Cobalt:  16 % by 2031 (26% by 2036), Lead: 85% (85%), Nickel: 6% (12%), Lithium 6% (15%)
column5: The recycled content targets in TA3.18 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: All batteries incorporated in market products shall be readily removable and replaceable by the end-user at any time during the lifetime (except some derogations)
column5: The design for removability and replaceability of batteries in TA3.19 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Reduce landfill to a maximum of 10% of municipal waste
column5: The reduction of landfill in TA3.2 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: No later than 31 December 2025 - 75% by average weight of lead-acid batteries, - 80% by average weight of nickel-cadmium batteries
column5: The recycling efficiency targets in TA3.20 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: No later than 31 December 2025 - 65% by average weight of lithium-based batteries
column5: The recycling efficiency targets in TA3.21 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027 - 90% for cobalt, copper, lead, and nickel
column5: The material recovery targets in TA3.22 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027 - 50% lithium
column5: The material recovery targets in TA3.23 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column5: The reduction of food waste in TA3.24 may have a negative impact on the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 if it leads to increased transportation costs for food products.

column2: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30 % in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column5: The reduction of food waste in TA3.25 may have a negative impact on the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 if it leads to increased transportation costs for food products.

column2: Making all packaging recyclable
column5: The recyclability of packaging in TA3.27 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste, per unit of packaging: From 1 January 2030 (i) 30% for contact sensitive packaging made from polyethylene terephthalate (PET) as major component
column5: The recycled content targets in TA3.28 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Member States shall take measures to achieve a sustained reduction in the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags on their territory.
column5: The reduction of plastic carrier bags in TA3.29 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Reduce packaging waste by 5% per Member State per capita compared to 2018 by 2030, 10% by 2035 and 15% by 2040
column5: The reduction of packaging waste in TA3.30 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Recycling or preparing for re-use 65% of all packaging waste by 2025, 70% by 2030
column5: The recycling and re-use targets in TA3.31 can positively impact the reduction of external costs of transport in TA4.50 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Recycling of aluminium in packaging: 60%

column2: Zero-emission large aircraft will become market ready

column2: Euro 7 pollutant limits
column5: The implementation of Euro 7 pollutant limits in TA4.47 can positively impact the protection of the environment and restoration of natural resources in TA3.11 by promoting sustainable practices and reducing pollution.

column2: All external costs of transport within the EU will be covered by the transport users
column5: The coverage of external costs of transport in TA4.50 can positively impact the collection and recycling of batteries in TA3.15 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Seamless multimodal passenger transport will be facilitated by integrated electronic ticketing
column5: The facilitation of seamless multimodal passenger transport in TA4.51 can positively impact the collection targets for waste LMT batteries in TA3.16 by promoting sustainable transportation practices.

column2: The death toll for all modes of transport in the EU will be close to zero
column5: The reduction of the death toll in TA4.53 can positively impact the recycled content targets in industrial batteries, electric vehicle batteries, LMT batteries, and SLI batteries in TA3.18 by promoting sustainable transportation practices.

column2: Active transport modes, such as cycling, have seen growth with cities announcing over 2300 km of extra cycling infrastructure.
column5: The growth of active transport modes in TA4.54 can positively impact the design for removability and replaceability of batteries in TA3.19 by promoting sustainable transportation practices.

column2: Zero-emission in urban logistics
column5: The implementation of zero-emission urban logistics in TA4.55 can positively impact the reduction of landfill in TA3.2 by promoting sustainable waste management practices.

column2: Increase the uptake of short-sea shipping instead of using more polluting modes
column5: The increase of short-sea shipping in TA4.56 can positively impact the recycling efficiency targets in TA3.20 by promoting sustainable transportation practices.

column5: The renovation of the EU's maritime fleet in TA4.57 can positively impact the recycling efficiency targets in TA3.21 by promoting sustainable transportation practices.

column2: Pursue the objective of zero-emission ports

column2: Synthetic aviation fuels are expected to play a role in the decarbonisation of the sector already by 2030 and should contribute to at least 35% of the aviation fuel mix by 2050, according to the EC proposal for ReFuelEU Aviation
column5: The development of synthetic aviation fuels in TA4.6 can positively impact the material recovery targets in TA3.23 by promoting sustainable aviation practices.

column2: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (B) the combined share of advanced biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part A of Annex IX and of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the energy supplied to the transport sector is at least 1 % in 2025 and 3,5 % in 2030, of which a share of at least 1 percentage point is from renewable fuels of non-biological origin in 2030
column5: The implementation of the fuel supplier obligations in TA4.7 can positively impact the reduction of food waste in TA3.24 by promoting sustainable transportation practices.

column2: Member States with maritime ports should endeavour to ensure that from 2030 the share of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the total amount of energy supplied to the maritime transport sector is at least 1,2 %.
column5: The implementation of the renewable fuel targets in TA4.8 can positively impact the reduction of food waste in TA3.25 by promoting sustainable transportation practices.
